Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mama_Masha9
Reviews.Content: We had a romantic weekend in Venice in April 2012 and we were very happy with the hotel choice. The location is perfect - just between San Marco and the Rialto. Easy reach from the airport - vaporetto/water bus takes it 40-50 min from the Marco Polo airport to the Rialto pier which is 3-5 min walk from the hotel. Try not to take bus or car from the airport cause it will get you to the central bus station and you should then walk the same 40-50 min. to the hotel or take water taxi. We booked a "channel view" room. One of 3 (!) room windows was just above the bridge, opening the view on the charming street with murano glass shops and restaurants with fresh seafood on ice. Nice thing about this channel and bridge is that when it's raining, gondolas will stop straight under the bridge to keep their passengers dry. Some of those gondolas come with singers who don't stop their (prepaid) songs regardless of the weather. So during the short rainy moments you will get some nice free entartainement. Very romantic. There's a charming roof terrace in the hotel with views on the surrounding streets and tiled roofs . Very nice just to sit for a while and sip some wine. A nice touch to the overall great impression you will get from Venice. The only reproach to the hotel - rather poor breakfast (regular for Italy) with a horrible chemical undrinkable coffee...

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Faribs
Reviews.Content: Great price, Great location with a view of the cannal without paying the price of having the view and great breakfast with fresh fruits and a lot more. We stayed in a triple-bed room no the fourth floor and absolutely enjoyed our stay! It was in the heart of Venice; a straight street to San Marcos and to the Grand Cannal.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for visiting Venice”
Reviews.Author: ervepe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated between the San Marco square end the Rialto Bridge (Each about a 5 minute walk) - Rooms are cleaned properly ervery day. Rooms are not big but just what you need for a 3-4 days visit. Breakfast is good, not a buffet but reasena le choice. You cqn mqke coffe or tea at your room and the prices in the minibar are not expensive. But 1 remark (as most of the reviewers say) is the fact that there is no elevator, but we have checked and most of the smaller hotels in the old houses don't have one. However if we ho back to Venice we would book the Al Gambero again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: ravenjess
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night but I remember it well. The location is ideal. The room was very nice and clean and I had a view of the canal, really special. I remember feeling the whole time that I was getting way more than I paid for and I hope they haven't raised their prices. The staff was exceptionally friendly, particularly the waiters downstairs- gave me directions and pointers. Breakfast was good and in a charming, sunlit spot. My room was hard to find, sort of secluded within the hotel, with some narrow stairs to navigate. That's probably why it was cheaper- but that also meant it was quiet and private. yea!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique, Cozy and Romantic- Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: AmyO_11TX
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but charming, cozy and CLEAN- decorated Venitian style with lots of details. Free breakfast and mingling with the owner and other travelers - very quaint! We paid a bit extra to have a window that opened to the canal â€“ although you had to stick your head out and look down to see it. Still - that's about as good as it gets for the price. :) Hotel is snug within city center. Cute wine bar right next door down in the basement, right on a canal. Venice is a walking & boat city only so itâ€™s a bit of a challenge to find down some alleyways, so knowing where you're going first is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetotravel22_10
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, with great location. OK breakfast and staff. Our room faced the small canal in front of the hotel and it was very nice to open our window in the morning and see the gondolas passing by . Venice is a very beautiful and romantic city; don't miss a change to visit it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: S K
Reviews.Content: Good location and friendly Italian staff. Rooms quite clean but cold. Overall impression was simply lovely! Would recommend for those who don't mind walking the steps since no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Bella! Gorgeous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mishd676
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel with gorgeous water views. Open your windows and hear the gondola drivers singing and wake up to church bells chiming in the distance! The staff were so helpful and friendly. Great fresh breakfast every morning served with freshly brewed coffee. Loved our stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Grauntie
Reviews.Content: Our last two nights in Italy were spent in Venice at the Locanda Al Gambero, and it was a lovely way to end a memorable trip. It was easy to find from the directions provided, and our rooms were comfortable, and very clean. My room had a view over one of the smaller canals, and while yes, you had to lean out of the window to see it, the view of the quaint bridge and passing gondolas was a special treat. We had booked single rooms, but must have been upgraded to doubles, as the bed was large and the room very comfortable. The staff is professional, if not always warm, though at least two of the gentlemen were very kind and helpful with inquiries, one making arrangements for our taxi to the airport, and another volunteering to make restaurant reservations. Omar provided kind email reassurance prior to arrival answering questions I had about the rooms. Some comments here mentioned the lack of baggage help, but a gentleman was available when we arrived, and offered to take the bags to our rooms, even though we did not need it. Breakfast included fresh fruit, bread, yogurt, meat and cheese along with good strong cappuccino -- more than enough to start the day, and more varied than we experienced in other hotels. A room with complimentary computers was also appreciated. It is hard to imagine a better location, so close to the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco and many restaurants in the area. And the rate was incredibly reasonable for us, especially considering the expense of Venice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, yet economical.”
Reviews.Author: Treviglas
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here. Chosen after reading a gzillion Venice hotel reviews over a period of several days until my eyes crossed! Al Gambero ticked all the boxes. Very central. Economical (in the Venetian sense perhaps!) when compared to other hotels in the immediate area. 3 minute walk from Rialto Bridge and 3 min walk from Piazza San Marco (on the same calle! didn't even need the map!) Very pleasant and knowledgable owners and staff. Only thing not ideal - the hotel has 4 floors and no elevator . . . . we were on the fourth floor, and as we are not the fittest of travellers we were glad we only travelled with cabin baggage! After four days of up and down four flights we discovered calf muscles . . . . but still would not fault the hotel - there is no space to install an elevator. Perhaps worth enquiring about possibility of a room on 1st or 2nd floor. Had a nice meal in the hotel's own restaurant - however even with 10% residents discount, meal for two with wine was â‚¬135 which is rather exensive, but found all 'good' restaurants between 80 - 100 for two people. (Yes, there are cheaper places to eat - there is also a lot of pizza and hot dogs . . . . ) Lovely city, would go again - three days would be enough unless you need to see every church and every museum . . .

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, great location, great shower”
Reviews.Author: revlewis
Reviews.Content: Small and cosy hotel, very good service, small rooms, but great beds and silentc rooms. If you like to sleep late in the morning, then of course the city center is not the place for you, otherwise you will spend a great night. The best thing is the shower: a lot of water, perfect temperature, bathtube in good conditions... wonderful pleasure. The location is also perfect: near both to Rialto and to San Marco, you can go anywhere in a few minutes. Definitely to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: chicgail
Reviews.Content: There are unquestionably worse hotels. I've stayed in some of them, but you want to know: There is no lift. "Canal View" means that if you open the window, stick your head out and look down you will see a canal. You have to decide if that is worth the extra money to you. Had we known, we would not have paid the difference. The staff is indifferent. Rooms are dark. That being said, it was clean and close to tourist attractions St. Marks and the Rialto Bridge/Market. I know it was Venice, but for me it is not sufficient for upwards of $300/night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: lkoondel
Reviews.Content: Very lovely hotel. Location is just right for seeing and getting from place to place. The hotel staff was wonderful, especially Omar. A special thanks to Sandro, owner, for making our stay in Venice most memorable. The breakfast was just right to start the day before going out for the days adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmelt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and it was fabulous. The late night doorman was not very much help and do NOT try to find any food late night in the hotel or you may stumble across him in the lounge room sleeping or not........every morning we woke up to the gondola drivers playing the accordian and singing beautiful Italian music from the canal that our window looked down on. Waking up to this is quite awe-inspiring.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent lodgings”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityTravels
Reviews.Content: A nice, quaint hotel in a great location in Venice. In general the San Marco area is overrun and crowded with people, however this was off a main street so the immediate area felt like a nice reprieve from the crush of tourists swarming the endless number of glass shops and clothing stores/boutiques. My main put-off of the hotel would be its steep stairs and no elevator. As Americans may tend to, we overpacked and had a number of heavy bags to lug up the stairs. The 2nd floor is the lobby, and our room was another 2 or 3 floors up from there. As we checked in the worker was generally nice enough but also didnâ€™t flinch for a second as if he was going to assist with our bags â€“ this is in line with the overall courtesy we saw in Venice compared with Tuscany and Rome, but I digress. The hotel room was small but in line with Europe standards. However the bath room was VERY small and cramped. It was 8 feet long but maybe 3 feet wide and that makes for a rough effort to walk past the toilet/bidet combo just to get to the shower (much less using one of those which ended up with knees on the facing wall, so yes, it is cramped). But, it was clean both in the room, bathroom and throughout which always is a plus and encouraging sign. I booked online a few months ago and my reservation went off without a hitch and they were ready for us (also a good sign). We left at 6am on our departure date as we were catching the first ferry to the airport from San Marco. The overnight worker was actually extremely nice. He fired up the coffee machine and pulled out some food for us before we left, which he didnâ€™t have to do since breakfast didnâ€™t â€˜officiallyâ€™ start til 7 or so. I appreciated the small gesture like that. Breakfast â€“ No, they didnâ€™t have a full, gluttonous spread like your average Courtyard Marriott or what most Americans are accustomed to back home. They had the standard Italian breakfast which can be good and satisfying (plus not overeat) of yogurt, fruit, rolls, coffee, etc. Overall â€“ the location and price were good, the bathroom size being the main drawback (but not a prohibitive feature unless we stayed more then the 3 days we did). Easy to get to from the Rialto vaporetto stop as long as you glanced at a map beforehand and have a sense of direction (getting lost is inevitable in Venice, but you can only get so lost).

Reviews.Title: “We return year after year”
Reviews.Author: rsimm1
Reviews.Content: Just back from an 8 day stay at Antica Locanda al Gambero where we have been stopping each of the past 14 years at least annually and some times twice. What we find important in selecting a place to rest our head at night is cleanliness as utmost with reception by staff, ideal location for our visitation, safety, amenities and fair pricing. In our experience as world wide travelers this facility under family management by Mr. Rossi offers all that we seek. The facility is a sparkling gem, staff is well informed, concerned for it's guests and offers advice as needed. You can't select a better location to find ease of arrival and departure by train or airline and getting to all points of interest in the city of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Your search for the perfect place to stay in Venice ends here!!!”
Reviews.Author: leatherandflorals
Reviews.Content: I could not have dreamed of a more perfect place to stay in Venice - this hotel was part of what made my whole experience of this amazing city so wonderful. The rooms were so beautifully decorated with all the mod cons (even tea and coffee!!!) and I loved to sit and write at the little desk by my window overlooking the canal, listening to the gondoliers singing as they rowed along - I kept having to pinch myself! Everything was perfect - staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful (especially the man who carried my bags up to my room), room was clean and comfortable, double glazed windows in case you wanted to block out the sound of the gondoliers, air con, huge bath and shower, great breakfast, easy (free) internet access, beautiful view (which I think would also be nice on the non-canal side), and UNBEATABLE location! Literally minutes from St Marks square one way, or the Rialto bridge the other way, and it was a nice walk too along cute shops and plenty of good places to get a quick bite. I have spent a lot of time in Venice and I have never stayed anywhere more beautiful, convenient, clean and comfortable. I will never stay anywhere else in Venice, this place is truly a gem in a city that can completely baffle someone looking for a good place to stay. So, seeing as I spent hours looking for Venice accommodation I will help you out - STOP LOOKING!!! IT DOESN'T GET BETTER THAN THIS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty sure I got bed bugs from here”
Reviews.Author: cambo_bob
Reviews.Content: My self and my traveling partner left with several bites, a couple in a row which is a tell tale sign of bedbugs. Now, at home I have been bitten also. Its a real drag as bed bugs are difficult to get rid of. Beware. Other than that the hotel was good, and the staff were nice, but the bed bugs mean that I can't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome change for European hotels”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller43
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for families. My wife and I traveled with our 2 children (under 10) and booked a quad room. The service and experience from the hotel manager that greeted us was above expectations and helped with our problem (in-house safe broken). His english was good, although we spoke italian I did notice he was more than helpful with other non italian speaking guests. The quad room was large enough to be comfortable compared to other places we stayed at. Bathroom was excellent for european standards with fully functioning shower and bath. No problems with drainage of water in shower. Only downside was that there is no lift and no one to help with luggage up stairs. In saying that we did not ask for help but noticed other more mature guests carting their own luggage up the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: IheartSugar
Reviews.Content: Great location and a friendly staff. The room was clean and luxurious. I did not shy away from taking a bath in the tub! :-) We had a amazing view of a canal from our window, it was breath taking. We arrived on the day of the festival and saw fireworks from our hotel window! The breakfast was yummy. My only complaint is there is no elevator, but you won't find many (if any) hotels in Venice with elevators! I would DEFINITELY go back! LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Beautiful Room, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Kristin_California
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly as advertised. Typical Venetian decor in their clean and modern rooms. We had a window that overlooked the canal and could hear the gondoliers singing as they passed by. We had a little trouble finding the hotel at first but Venice in general is difficult to navigate. It's a short walk to San Marco Square or the Rialto Bridge. We found the location to be very central. They do not have an elevator which was not a problem for us but beware that you will need to be able to walk several flights of stairs to get to your room. We accessed the internet in the lobby with no issues. The staff was not very good at recommending restaurants (other than their own). Try the Restaurant Noemi just down the street (toward San Marco), their scampi with zucchini and tomatoes was amazing. The hotel serves a basic continental breakfast. Overall we were very happy with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: eos99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 2009. Awesome hotel! Hotel Gambero is in a prime spot, located between the Rinalto Bridge and Piazza San Marco. We also got a sweet deal on the price (breakfast included). Free WiFi access available in all the rooms. Charming, spotless rooms with marble bathrooms, plus hot running water with good water pressure. English-speaking reception staff are friendly and helpful. Complimentary tea, coffee and water kettle in all the rooms. There's also a small terrace on the roof to rest your feet after walking all day in Venice to enjoy your complimentary tea or coffee. Wish we could have stayed for more nights in this wonderful hotel. Our stay in this hotel gave us an unforgettable experience in Venice. The only very minor catch that may turn some off is the hotel has no lift, but no big deal. It's not that difficult walking up stairs :). Don't let this deter you from staying here, I wanted to at least mention it so there's no surprises. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone planning a trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gem of a hotel, perfect location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveler_336
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure to stay at this delightful family run hotel in a superb location between Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge. It is far enough away from San Marco to be in a nice quiet location, yet near enough to be extremely convenient. The room was great, actually the most spacious of the three star hotels I stayed at on this trip (including Florence and Venice), it even had a full sized tub! Everything was clean and the bed was very comfortable. There was a problem with the mini-refridge which was promptly attended to and fixed, I couldn't have asked for more. ALL of the staff were friendly and helpful, they really made me feel at home. The dining recommendations were great, especially the Trattoria Ignazio and Trattoria Madonna in San Polo, be sure to get directions to these restuarant gems where the locals go, not the usual overpriced tourist traps and exceptional meals.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location / great value for a standard double”
Reviews.Author: rigoferi
Reviews.Content: We've been in Venice (al Gambero) during the carnival in Feb. 2009. The location is between the St Marco Square and Rialto Bridge. It's really handy if you'd like to have fun at evening/night. The interior design of the room is venezian style (small, warm feeling, good service) The breackfast is poor, if you compare to other places to venice. Additional info: If you go to Venice be carefull with the restaurants: the portion is really small, the drinks are very expensive, there is a table charge (0.5 - 3.0 EUR/person)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice!”
Reviews.Author: mpit935
Reviews.Content: Venice is AWESOME! This was a nice hotel in a great location. It was close to all the shopping, restaurants, and San Marcos square. The room was very clean and comfortable. It was small, but I'm sure all hotels in Venice are since it's a small town. We highly recommend getting a room with a view of the canal. It was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “A quaint little place in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Hemhem
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel, only returned back from Venice Sat 15th Nov 08 and had to write a review on this hotel. Conveniently located to both the Rialto Bridge and San Marco Square. A fantastic location to start off one of your numerous hikes across the city....Be warned, though, after a long days hike the only disappointing thing about this hotel was that it had no lift..could be a struggle if you've got loads of luggage or in a wheelchair. But in spite of that, the hotel staff was extremely friendly and so helpful. The waiter at breakfast was very sweet and looked after me like a daughter...lol. The reception staff were extremely helpful too, visiting Venice mid November is subject to torrential downpoor, oh and yes they suffer from acqua alta (high tides) practically most of Venice is flooded until 12pm and although San Marco Sq and Rialto and the other main tourist spots have duck boards in place to walk on getting there could be a problem and you would have to wade through water. In spite of this the hotel staff gave me these plastic wellies to put over your shoes/trainers and a brolly so that you could continue on your walks exploring Venice, without the weather and water putting you off. The rooms were extremely clean, fresh towels everyday, sky tv and a minibar. I was also lucky to get a room with the view of the little canal the hotel is next to, so when the golndolas went passed serenading their passengers it was very beautiful. In all, I absolutely adore this hotel and would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends. Single female traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great prices, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Kwikan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well placed in Venice for exploring the narrow streets and the wide piazzas. It's so close to San Marco and very easy to find from there. We arrived at night on the vapparetto from the airport and the walk across San Marco and into a narrow street and over the bridges to the hotel was magical. The staff in the Hotel were always friendly and helpful, the night porter being the nicest. The room we had was on the top floor and was perfectly clean. It was a good size with an alcove with a wardrobe and space for the bags, it was nice not to have to look at the bags during our stay. The decor in the room was a bit old fashioned but it is an old hotel and that is one of it's strengths, it is solid and quiet, you can't here any other guests going about their business. The bathroom was a good size, modern and clean. The breakfast was fine, nothing spectacular, but there was enough variety so you wouldn't have the same food every day. I would stay here again and would recommend it to all my friends without fear of the hotel letting me down.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: STL531
Reviews.Content: My family (parents and two college-age daughters) stayed in this hotel for three nights while visiting Venice. We were very pleased with the hotel. While we had a little confusion finding the right street when we first arrived (it is pretty narrow and looks like an alley from the walkway along the canal), the location is great--it is easy to get to both St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. The rooms were small but comfortable and clean, and the staff was courteous and helpful. I personally have no complaints about this hotel, but I should note that there is no elevator/lift and the main floor of the hotel is one flight up some narrow stairs, with rooms on the next three floors. It was a bit of a workout walking up to our third-floor room a few times a day!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate room- Good location”
Reviews.Author: JLutte
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Gambero. We booked a last minute room through their website for 130 Euro per night for a canal view. Our room was on the 3rd floor over the canal and bridge. At first we were worried about the noise from the people on the bridge below, but the windows were thick enough to keep that noise out at night. However, we were awakend early one morning by a delivery boat continuously reving his engine for about 30 minutes on the canal. But other than that, it was quiet. The room was small but adequate for our needs. We found the bed to be very comfortable. The breakfast was nice. It contained fruit, cereal, juice, bread, yogurt, coffee, tea, etc. The staff wasn't really that friendly. Not rude, just very "matter of fact." In summary, we felt the Hotel Gambero is an adequate hotel in a good location. But nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in central venice”
Reviews.Author: mariandfedeloveusa
Reviews.Content: We are two young italian sisters and we booked this hotel because we went to the international film festival in Venice. We decided to go there just few days before the event so it was hard to find free rooms but luckily we got one in this hotel and we are very happy of this. the hotel is in the centre of Venice, you can easily reach it from the station with the boat ( vaporetto in italian) and anyway many boats are so close and bring you everywhere. By walk you can go to the central St. Marco square and visit many other interesting places surrounding this hotel. The room was very very nice, it has a typical venice style, all the hotel was very typical and a little elegant, we had the breakfast included in the price and it was served in a nice room and was good. The staff was friendly and helped us to reach the place of the festival. If you are going to visit Venice we suggest this hotel, but not if you are a low budget traveller because for us it was quite expensive, even if it deserves the money. Anyway, if you are going to visit Venice be prepared that most of the inhabitants you find on your way when you are visiting are not too kind, at least with italian visitors. But don't worry, enjoy the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fazzaitken
Reviews.Content: Location: We (couple in late twenties) recently stayed at this hotel on a 2 night trip To Venice. The location is great for exploring all the sights, couldn't be better. It is such a small place anyway that it doesn't really matter but it was very well positioned. Rooms: We had a loevly room but it was in their new section, which did require a lot of steps and would not be good for anyone with walking difficulties. The hallway in the new section is lovely. The rooms were extremely clean. Our room had full venetian trimmings, such as ornate lights and fabrics, even all the walls in this hotel are covered in fabric! There is aircon, hairdryer, bidet, skynews, drinks in the room which all make a difference after a long day walking around Venice. Overall, having stayed in lots of european city break hotels, room 210 was excellent. Hotel: The breakfast was great. Fresh tea and coffee served to your table and an array of croissants, bread, cakes, yoghurts, cereals and meats. It was served till 10am too. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, although not for anyone with walking difficulties.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Torcello
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many Venice hotels it was nice to find a good small hotel that was so central. The staff were helpful and friendly. We booked three single rooms two of them were very comfortable with double beds the third on the top floor was a bit small but OK. The only major problem was the stairs which we knew about. I had 72 steps up and then down to my room - it kept me fit! The breakfast was mediocre but perfectly adequate. All together a comfortable friendly hotel which I would recommend to others. Slightly pricey but single rooms always are. Ideal for a first time visitor to Venice midway between St, Marks and the Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “Charming with Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kella
Reviews.Content: Excellent property! The rooms were a bit tight, but very clean and elegantly appointed. Great service at check-in, a small plate of cookies and chocolates. Beautiful canal view on a small side canal. We would open the French doors and be serenaded by singing gondoliers... very romantic! Fantastic location, two minutes from the square and grand canal. Very good breakfast too. Receptionist was a little cold, but overall accomodating. Can't wait to return...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: NekoCat
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this little hotel and was very pleased. We arrived before check-in time and immediately shown to our room, which had a window looking right onto a canal. There were free cookies on a tray and were replenished only after being gone a few hours. Strangely there was a nice shower, but no shower curtain, so the entire bathroom got soaked (twice). The breakfast buffet was small, but sufficient. We received a 5% discount for cash as well as a 10% discount at garage San Marco, so don't forget to ask.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the decor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, very pretty rooms. Reasonable clean. Free internet access, however frequently busy. Breakfast is okay. I didn't enjoy walking up 4 flights of stairs after walking all day. Apart from the man who was there when we left, the rest of the staff couldn't have been more unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “another of Venic,s secrects”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at AL gambero 5 or 6 times now both on my own and with my aunt , we have never had a bad experience yet. The staff are always so helpful and very pleasant without exception . The hotel is so well situated in the centre of Venice with easy access to all the sights. The bistro restaurant is good too but not patricularly cheap .We hope to return there for many year.s to come.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but expensive”
Reviews.Author: honung
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights, and had no problems at all. The room was a very small, but opened the window straight out onto a canal. It was decorated in red and gold, was very romantic, with a really nice bathroom. Breakfast was great, with attentive staff. It was very expensive, but I think everywhere in Venice is. We booked the day before we got there and I think they bumped the price up quite a lot, so book in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trav25SouthernCalif_
Reviews.Content: We loved this little hotel. We laughed at how this small hotel had no elevator but the biggest showers in Italy. The negative is that it really isn't all that close to the bus drop with all of your luggage and no elevator when you get there. Hauling the luggage down narrow sidewalks meant for 2 people (1 going the opposite direction) with your luggage and then getting to the hotel to find no help and your room 4 flights up was hard. On the positive note, we spent 3 nights here and this was our favorite place to visit. The hotel was in a great walking location, front desk staff very nice. Internet access, breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the elevator???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was closer to the water taxi stop. My husband and I and our friends are in our sixties, and the walk to the hotel seemed like a long schlepp, because we were dragging our luggage. When we arrived, hot and tired, we were told there was no elevator! Whew! So we proceeded to once again, lug everything up 3 flights. We were exhausted by then. The room was small but extremely clean. There were lovely linens on the very comfortable bed. We could open the shutters on our window and look down at a lovely canal, but the mosquitos wanted to stay in our room as much as we did! I recommend this hotel to younger, very in-shape travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth checking out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed three nights in the Al Gambero and were pleasantly surprised how good the accommodation was. From pictures available on the various e reservation sites the place looks like a no-star dump which turned out not to be the case (it has three stars). Our triple room was of adequate size and spotless, the bathroom was recently renovated and had an excellent shower and the view out our window was of the bell tower in St.Marks Square. Our room had excellent air conditioning which, is very important in Venice if you need to keep your windows closed at night to keep out Mosquitoes. Hotel staff were friendly and courteous and there was free broadband Internet between certain hours in reception. Breakfast consisted of basic cereal and processed cheese - best to find a good Coffee shop down a side street. As far as location is concerned, it couldn't be better...3 minutes walk to St.Mark's square & 6 minutes to the Rialto bridge. All together a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Small Location”
Reviews.Author: Go4Fun
Reviews.Content: Was in Venice in Sept 2005 and stayed at Al Gambero for 2 nights. As with all hotels in Venice, very small room and shower for the money. But, location between Rialto and San Marco was excellent. Very convenient. Friendly staff. Breakfast was in a nice sunny room with modest selection of fruit and pastries. 210E. Would stay there again, but would rather look for other alternatives as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel within a few minutes of the main sights”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent long weekend in Venice made completely comfortable by this small but well kept, friendly hotel that is literally a few minutes from St Marks Square and the Rialto Bridge. Our room was clean and in good condition. The higher up you go in the hotel the greater your chance of hearing the church bells in the night. Breakfast was fine, with limited but nevertheless very adequate choice & the coffee was good. There is a restaurant right alongside the entrance but it is pricey. However within 5/10 minutes walk there is lots of choice of places to eat; welcome after a long journey. If, like us, you catch a waterbus from Marco Polo Airport then the hotel is about 10/15 minutes walk with your bags. Straightforward but keep your map handy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located between St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. The location is perfect and quiet. It sits on a small canal but the canal was smelly during July. We had a canal side room, it was small but very clean and the bathrooms were newly remodeled. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They offer a nice breakfast and I never had to wait for the internet. There is no elevator so if you are not traveling light request the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: kkic04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were very pleased with the room and location. The place is about 10 minute walk from the Rialto stop, down a crack between two buildings that is very easy to walk by. St. Marks is less than 5 minutes down the same "street." We had a room overlooking a canal and bridge and as it was our honeymoon, was very romantic at night with a bottle of wine. The room had a mini-fridge and good size bathroom. Some of the hotel staff were a little cool, but the rest were friendly and gladly helped with concert tickets and booking water taxis. I would definately stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Antica Locanda al Gambero
HotelInfo.Address: Calle dei Fabbri, 4687 S.Marco, 30124 Venice, Italy
